benefits.title: A possible role for lutein and zeaxanthin in cognitive function in the elderly.
benefits.summary: Dietary lutein and zeaxanthin may be beneficial in maintaining cognitive health, as they are related to improved memory retention, verbal fluency, and reduced dementia severity in older adults.
benefits.journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

benefits.title: Dietary guidance for lutein: consideration for intake recommendations is scientifically supported
benefits.summary: Lutein has potential health benefits, including improving visual performance and reducing the risk of age-related macular degeneration.

benefits.title: Mechanistic insights into the effect of lutein on atherosclerosis, vascular dysfunction, and related risk factors: a systematic review of in vivo, ex vivo and in vitro studies.
benefits.summary: Lutein has positive effects on atherosclerosis development, inflammation, and endothelial dysfunction.

benefits.title: Lutein supplementation combined with a low-calorie diet in middle-aged obese individuals: effects on anthropometric indices, body composition and metabolic parameters
benefits.summary: Lutein supplementation combined with a low-calorie diet can improve body composition and lipid profile in obese middle-aged individuals.

benefits.title: The body of evidence to support a protective role for lutein and zeaxanthin in delaying chronic disease. Overview.
benefits.summary: Lutein and zeaxanthin may protect against the development of eye diseases like aging, cataract, and macular degeneration.

benefits.title: Effects of lutein and zeaxanthin on aspects of eye health.
benefits.summary: Lutein and zeaxanthin have a potential role in preventing and treating eye diseases like age-related macular degeneration, cataract, and retinitis pigmentosa.
benefits.journal: Journal of the science of food and agriculture

benefits.title: Lutein and Zeaxanthin Isomers in Eye Health and Disease.
benefits.summary: Lutein and its isomers play important roles in ocular development, vision performance, and lowering risk for age-related eye diseases.

benefits.title: The Effect of Lutein on Eye and Extra-Eye Health
benefits.summary: Lutein improves or prevents age-related macular disease, ameliorates cognitive function, decreases cancer risk, and improves cardiovascular health.

benefits.title: Lutein as a functional food ingredient: Stability and bioavailability
benefits.summary: Lutein has antioxidant potential, plays a significant role in preventing age-related macular degeneration and other diseases, and is essential in infant brain development.

benefits.title: Supercritical Fluid Extraction of Lutein from Scenedesmus almeriensis
benefits.summary: Lutein has health benefits such as preventing age-related macular degeneration, cataracts, ameliorating atherosclerosis, and preventing some types of cancer.

side effects.title: Evaluation of Delestrogen and Parlodel as a luteolytic agent in humans.
side effects.summary: Side effects of luteolytic therapy include lethargy, dizziness, nausea, vomiting, hot flashes, depression, and nasal congestion.

side effects.title: Lutein in patients with cataracts and age-related macular degeneration : a long-term supplementation study
side effects.summary: No significant side effects such as hypercarotenemia, carotenodermia, or changes in biochemical or haematological profile were observed with lutein supplementation.
side effects.journal: Journal of the Science of Food and Agriculture

side effects.title: Mechanistic insights into the effect of lutein on atherosclerosis, vascular dysfunction, and related risk factors: a systematic review of in vivo, ex vivo and in vitro studies.
side effects.summary: Lutein has positive effects on atherosclerosis development and some common risk factors, including inflammation and endothelial dysfunction.

side effects.title: Modulation of DNA-Induced Damage and Repair Capacity in Humans after Dietary Intervention with Lutein-Enriched Fermented Milk
side effects.summary: Consumption of lutein-enriched fermented milk improves DNA resistance to damage and repair capacity in lymphocytes without causing genotoxic effects or side effects on other nutritional and biochemical markers.

side effects.title: Toxicity Profile of Lutein and Lutein Ester Isolated From Marigold Flowers (Tagetes erecta)
side effects.summary: Lutein and its ester form did not produce any mortality, change in body weight, food consumption pattern, organ weight, and other adverse side reactions in rats.

side effects.title: Erectile function and nocturnal penile tumescence in patients with prostate cancer undergoing luteinizing hormone‐releasing hormone agonist therapy
side effects.summary: LHRH agonists suppress testicular androgen production, potentially affecting erectile function.

side effects.title: The Pharmacological Effects of Lutein and Zeaxanthin on Visual Disorders and Cognition Diseases
side effects.summary: Moderate intakes of lutein and zeaxanthin are associated with decreased age-related macular degeneration risk and less visual impairment.
side effects.journal: Molecules : A Journal of Synthetic Chemistry and Natural Product Chemistry

side effects.title: Lutein, but not alpha-tocopherol, supplementation improves visual function in patients with age-related cataracts: a 2-y double-blind, placebo-controlled pilot study.
side effects.summary: No significant side effects or changes in biochemical or hematologic profiles were observed in any of the subjects during the study.

side effects.title: The Effect of Lutein on Eye and Extra-Eye Health
side effects.summary: Sustained lutein consumption may contribute to reducing the burden of several chronic diseases, including age-related macular disease, cognitive function, cancer risk, and cardiovascular health.

side effects.title: Apricot carotenoids possess potent anti-amyloidogenic activity in vitro.
side effects.summary: Lutein in apricot fruits shows strong inhibitory effects on AÎ2 fibril formation, suggesting potential as a preventive agent for amyloid-associated diseases.
side effects.journal: Journal of agricultural and food chemistry

dosage.title: Plasma kinetics of lutein, zeaxanthin, and 3-dehydro-lutein after multiple oral doses of a lutein supplement.
dosage.summary: Long-term supplementation with 4.1 and 20.5 mg lutein increased plasma lutein concentrations approximately 3.5- and 10-fold, respectively.
dosage.journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

dosage.title: Effect of Supplemental Lutein and Zeaxanthin on Serum, Macular Pigmentation, and Visual Performance in Patients with Early Age-Related Macular Degeneration
dosage.summary: 10 mg lutein daily might be an advisable long-term dosage for early AMD treatment.

dosage.title: Lutein in patients with cataracts and age-related macular degeneration : a long-term supplementation study
dosage.summary: Three lutein capsules per week provided about 12 mg of all-trans-lutein, 3 mg of 13/15-cis-lutein, and 3.3mg of Î± -tocopherol.
dosage.journal: Journal of the Science of Food and Agriculture

dosage.title: Dose-dependent response of serum lutein and macular pigment optical density to supplementation with lutein esters.
dosage.summary: Doses of lutein supplements range from 5 to 20 mg, with serum lutein concentration and macular pigment optical density responding linearly to dose.

dosage.title: Ovulation Induction and Conception Using Subcutaneous Pulsatile Luteinizing Hormone- Releasing Hormone
dosage.summary: Response to luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone appears to be dose-related, and 240 Î± g/day is effective for ovulation induction.

dosage.title: The relationship between the pituitary response to luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone and the ovulatory response to clomiphene citrate.
dosage.summary: A serum luteinizing hormone level higher than 45 mIU/ml at 30 or 45 minutes after injection was considered a "positive response" to LH-RH.

dosage.title: Effect of mono- and diglycerides on the digestion and absorption of lutein in lymph fistula rats.
dosage.summary: 20 mg/kg lutein is the saturable level of lymphatic lutein absorption, with no lutein detected in portal circulation at any dosage level tested.
dosage.journal: American journal of physiology. Gastrointestinal and liver physiology

dosage.title: [Protective effect of lutein against blue light-induced retinal damage in rat].
dosage.summary: Lutein dosages in this study were 0.5 mg/ml, 1.0 mg/ml, and 2.0 mg/mI, with a significant effect on preventing retina light damage.
dosage.journal: Wei sheng yan jiu = Journal of hygiene research

dosage.title: Evaluation of Different Delivery Vehicles on the Digestion and Absorption of Lutein using a Lymph Fistula Rat Model
dosage.summary: 20 mg/kg lutein in safflower oil suspension is the saturable level of lymphatic lutein absorption in rats.
